donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The joint programme on gender equality and women's empowerment in the occupied Palestinian territory (oPt) will promote Palestinian women's social, economic and political empowerment.  It will aim to reduce all forms of gender-based violence (GBV), particularly violence against women and girls, by: enhancing and increasing their political voice at the local and national levels; increasing their opportunity to obtain decent and productive work, and improving their access to protection and justice. 
This will be done through: 
1- Establish a baseline database on VAW, GBV, including domestic violence.
2. Rehabilitation and equipment of selected premises in the Gaza Strip to host the first multipurpose "Centre for the Protection  Empowerment of Women and Families". 
3. Develop specialized curricula and training material,  conduct training for 240 judges, lawyers and prosecutors on gender issues and the provision of assistance to victims of violence and GBV. 
4. Provide gender awareness training to 300 local government staff  to develop their capacity on mainstreaming gender in district development planning and service provision.

project_descr: As part of the (MDG) six UN Agencies, namely UNDP/PAPP, UN-Women, ILO, UNESCO, UNFPA and UNRWA, are implementing a Joint Programme on the promotion of Palestinian women's social, economic and political empowerment
project_title: Gender Equality and Women's  Empowerment in the oPt
